summary: This document consists of four consecutive daily lieutenant's logs from the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, NY, covering three shifts (Morning, Day, Evening) on Sunday, August 11, 2019. The logs detail routine operations, inmate counts, and the intake of a new inmate by the FBI late in the evening. The date is significant as it is the day before Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody.

persons.name: Mora
persons.context: Inmate placed in Administrative Detention from unit 11S at 1:41 AM for 'PENDING INVESTIGATION'.

persons.name: Lieutenant
persons.context: Multiple unnamed lieutenants who assumed duties as the Operations Lieutenant for the Morning, Day, and Evening watches, conducting routine facility checks and counts.

events.title: Inmate Mora placed in Administrative Detention
events.description: Inmate Mora (Reg #87036-054) was moved to special housing from unit 11S at 1:41 AM for a pending investigation.

events.title: FBI delivers new inmate to MCC
events.description: At 11:05 PM, the FBI arrived with one new inmate commit (Reg #76330-054), a safekeep, who was placed on the second-floor suicide watch area with a companion due to lack of bed space in the Special Housing Unit.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
keyFacts: The logs document routine operations at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York on August 11, 2019.
Multiple inmates were on psychological observation or suicide watch with inmate companions, including inmates with registration numbers 71230-054, 85428-054, 78640-054, and 85775-054.

The FBI delivered a new inmate (Reg #76330-054), a safekeep, to the facility at 11:05 PM, who was placed on the second-floor suicide watch area with a companion due to overcrowding in the Special Housing Unit.
The fire alarm public address system was inoperable during the Day and Evening watches, preventing standard PREA (Prison Rape Elimination Act) announcements.

The date of the logs, August 11, 2019, is the day before Jeffrey Epstein was found deceased in his cell at this facility on August 10, 2019, indicating these logs cover the final full day of his life in custody.
